Articles.Content:
Simple enough, post your highest speed achieved on Kerbal Space Program, on any update revision. You can post pics if you want to, I suppose ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Here\'s mine:

> ![eghr.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/17887537/stuff/eghr.png)

If this has already been posted, sorry.
Mine is 180,000 something like yours, again, achieved with stock by getting grabbed and crossing way past the point where i should be below the surface of the star.

I did the same thing, but was more careful about completely removing my horizontal velocity.

> ![cwp4O.png](http://i.imgur.com/cwp4O.png)

> 
> I did the same thing, but was more careful about completely removing my horizontal velocity.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> > ![cwp4O.png](http://i.imgur.com/cwp4O.png)

You have surpassed the speed of light, sir, by 4,194,580 m/s

You have broken science.

> 
> You have surpassed the speed of light, sir, by 4,194,580 m/s
> 
> You have broken science.

Sorry, had to sig.

> 
> Sorry, had to sig.

Cheers, I suppose ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Sure the star thing is easy, 190km/s + isn\'t a problem with physics glitches.

But what about the fastest reentry speed?

18,844 m/s - Stock engines and fuel tanks (ok, I used mech jeb for some navigation help)

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/AXv9zBO_kbU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
I reached 60,000 m/s cruising out of the solar system, but now I\'m out of fuel and stranded :-[
About 3000m/s, just re-entering. Probably could\'ve gone faster if my parachute hadn\'t deployed itself.

> 
> About 3000m/s, just re-entering. Probably could\'ve gone faster if my parachute hadn\'t deployed itself.

My parachute deploys itself, I find it very annoying.
There was a 'Largest re-entry g force' challenge at one point that you may find interesting to see the largest reentry speeds. I hit around 6000m/s.

200,000 M/S

using my engine from creeper corp.
